title: Palaeogeography
summary: Palaeogeography (or paleogeography) is the study of historical geography, generally physical landscapes.[2]  Palaeogeography can also include the study of human or cultural environments.  When the focus is specifically on landforms, the term paleogeomorphology is sometimes used instead. Paleomagnetism, paleobiogeography, and tectonic history are among its main tools.
